properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 30 at 6:15PM MST until January 30 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Southeastern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming...
Southwestern Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming...

* Until 700 PM MST.

* At 615 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Federal to 8 miles northwest of Natural Fort to
near Rockport, moving southwest at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and
blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph.

SOURCE...Observed.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 9.
Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 334 and 359.

Locations impacted include...
Granite Springs Reservoir, North Crow Campground, Federal, Granite
Springs Campground, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground,
Buford, South Greeley and Warren AFB.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits.
Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions,
making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped
vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow
squall arrives.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 7:00 PM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
